numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Colleges are more likely to accept a student who is rich.
2. Colleges are more likely to accept a student who is a legacy student.
4. There is a large gap between the 2 lines.
5. The gap stays consistent for the whole graph.
6. A legacy student has about 2 times a greater chance of admission than a non-legacy student.
7. This difference holds regardless of income.
8. I wonder whether this is true for non-Ivy-League schools.
10. I wonder whether colleges consider money as a deciding factor.
11. I wonder whether colleges have only raised their standards.
12. Many students in my community are not in the 90th percentile or higher.
13. Many students in my community are not legacy students.
14. This data can help us understand what schools look for.
15. The headline is: The Data Behind College Admissions: Does Your Income and Legacy Truly Matter?
